attributes.action: consider using reward rather than punishment in anti polution/congestion taxation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We always seem to be taxed more as a way of stopping us doing anti social things. Why not consider rewarding us for not doing something. For example, to help reduce congestion on our roads, we could offer a reduced rate road tax which would only allow the vehicle to be used at quieter times, (ie through the night.) If we could encourage freight to move during the night, then the roads would benefit during the busy daytimes.
In the same way, if freight were moved by rail or even canals, then there should be a tax benefit.
In short, reward instead of punsment.
